history.text: Hello
Hey. I love action movies.
Me Too! I was really impressed by that John Wick film starring Keanu Reeves that came out in 2014. Did you get a chance to see it? If so, how did you feel about it?
Yea Ive seen it recently. I thought it was really good. Had enough action in it to keep me entertained
Did you like it?
Yes I definitely did. I really liked the supporting cast. I thought Alfie Allen gave a really strong performance with their role. I always love plots that involve hitman
I thought some of the reviews were a little tough on the film though. Did you agree with the critics?

The plot itself for me with his wife being killed and him wanting revenge seemed kind of stale but it still played out pretty well in the movie. I thought some of the reviews made pretty good sense but yea others not so much

Yes, I think the plot was pretty well laid out. I think it was difficult for both directors to have as much creative input as they wanted, I wonder why only one of them were actually credited on the film though?
Yea thats a good question. Probably something political
True! I really like how much backstory the movie gave on the characters. It was really cool to learn about John Wicks involvement with the Russian crime syndicate.
Yea that was cool. And I love that they picked Russia. Perfect for a hitman type movie
Definitely. I could see this movie having a sequel or a spin-off film of some type too. The ending left it open for follow-ups.
There actually is a sequel out
Oh wow. I had no idea. I definitely need to check that out then. Do you know when it came out?
I dont remmber exactly but it wasnt too long ago
Okay cool. I also really liked the setting of most of this film. The scene where John went to Little Russia was so cultural to me.
I liked that they also included a hitwoman in the movie as well

For sure. I really like how committed these two directors were towards character development. I think the Hitman film idea has been done numerous times in movies  but the dialogue and costume design of this film really made it stand out from the others.
Yea this easily could have been another boring hitman movie but they did a very good job with it
Definitely. I am always a fan of violence in action movies, but the slight moments of humor definitely stuck with me after watching the film.
And the slight humor fits Keanu Reeves strengths along with the action

That's for sure. I really enjoyed how they closed out the last scene too. The confrontation with Viggo was what I had been waiting on all film. Still don't know why he let himself get stabbed but the fight was pretty intense.
Yes that scene did not dissapoint
I definitely thought the ending was a little cheesy though. Saving the injured puppy was a little dramatic.
I didnt like how they killed the dog in the begining
Yeah it was definitely unnecessary. I guess the writers felt like they needed to bring everything full circle. Seems like they could of done without both scenes entirely in my opinion.
Yea it deffinitely did not seem essential to the rest of the plot
That's for sure. Thanks for talking to me about this.

uid2response.feedback: Thank you for allowing me to participate. My partner was a joy to talk to. I hope I completed this HIT accurately.
